display or object in its usual direction to reveal what's on the other side.", 'Inverted image: Digitally manipulating an image to present it from the opposite perspective.', 'Cross-section view: Examining a three-dimensional object by cutting through it, often used in medical imaging and architecture.', 'Lateral scan: Performing a side-to facial or body inspection, which can reveal details not easily visible from typical front views.', "Peripheral vision: Utilizing the edges of one's visual field to capture information outside of the direct line of sight.", 'Auxiliary perspective: Using an additional vantage point or camera setup that provides a unique viewpoint.', 'Contrast enhancement: Applying image processing techniques to highlight differences between sides for better visibility.', 'Infrared imaging: Employing infrared cameras to detect temperature differentials and uncover hidden features.', 'Side-by-side comparison: Laying two images side by side, one being the standard view and another showing the "normal" side for contrast.', 'Augmented reality overlay: Using AR technology to project additional information or highlight the typically ignored area on a real-world object.', 'Flipbook animation: Creating an animated flipbook where each page represents a different side, making it easier to study both perspectives.', 'Interactive 3D modeling: Utilizing software that allows for interactive exploration of models from various angles.', 'Reversed lighting direction: Changing the light source angle so that previously shadowy areas become illuminated, revealing details in a new way.', 'Zoomed-in focus: Using optical zoom or digital magnification to concentrate on specific features not visible at a normal scale.', 'Rotational viewing: Physically rotating an object while observing it can uncover aspects that are usually hidden from the initial perspective.']
